My understanding of the main Nebraska Electoral College vote distribution Lyle, is that they take their two senators are Statewide office holders. And so, after the presidential election, they give two votes to the winner of the popular vote in the state. So, based on the idea that the two senators give those two votes and then for each congressional district that they have, they actually look at the vote within those Congressional.

Well, boundaries and distribute, the additional Electoral College votes based on that. So instead of doing everybody who ever wins, 50% plus one, they get all the votes. It's well whoever wins the majority in the state gets to
All Arguments Summarized:
1. The Electoral College system allocates additional votes to boundaries and distributed based on the state's population.
2. Instead of the candidate who receives 50% plus one of the total votes winning, the candidate who wins the majority of votes in a state receives all of that state's votes.
